result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Groshek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey Groshek is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey Groshek was found guilty of Fail/Attach Ear Tag to Deer Carcass, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.347(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear

supervisions.notes: NOTE: 6/23/15 Br. II also approved assessing the $750 Natural Resources surcharge. Payment plan established.

NOTE: 6/23/15 Br. II also approved assessing the $200 DNA surcharge. Payment plan established.
** Amended 8/10/15 to include $483.73 of attorney fees paid to Patrick Ritter. Existing payment plan will be updated to include this assessment. **
Chapter 29 approvals revoked for a 3-year period.
** Amended 9/3/15 to include the firearm is ordered to be confiscated and destroyed. **

Elements

Defendant Jeffrey Groshek in court with attorney Patrick K Ritter. 
James H. Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea entered on Count 2 after questioning and advisement of rights. 
Plea accepted to Count 2 and Court finds guilty. 
Court further dismisses Counts 1 & 3. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Court sentences to pay $1000 fine and costs = $1513, due in 60 days or set up a payment plan with COC office. 
Court further orders Chapter 29 Approvals be revoked for period of 3 years. 
Advised of appeal rights.
